title: CAMBRIDGE UNIVERSITY PRESS ADVANCED TOPICS IN BISIMULATION AND C
description:
<--( RELEASE )--------------------------------------------------------------->
TITLE........: ADVANCED TOPICS IN BISIMULATION AND COINDUCTION

PUBLISHER....: CAMBRDIGE UNIVERSITY PRESS-  LANGUAGE......: ENGLISH
LINK.........:      -  RELEASE TYPE..: RETAIL        
FORMAT.......: PDF                       -  RELEASE DATE..: 2013/07/09    
ISBN.........: 9781107004979             -  STORE DATE....: 2011      
AUTHOR.......: DAVIDE SANGIORGI          -  DISKS.........: 01
               JAN RUTTEN

SAVED MONEY..: 99 DOLLAR

<--( BOOK )------------------------------------------------------------------->
Coinduction is a method for specifying and reasoning about infinite data types 
and automata with infinite behaviour. In recent years, it has come to play an 
ever more important role in the theory of computing. It is studied in many 
disciplines, including process theory and concurrency, modal logic and 
automata theory. Typically, coinductive proofs demonstrate the equivalence of 
two objects by constructing a suitable bisimulation relation between them. 
This collection of surveys is aimed at both researchers and Master's students 
in computer science and mathematics and deals with various aspects of 
bisimulation and coinduction, with an emphasis on process theory. Seven 
chapters cover the following topics: history, algebra and coalgebra, 
algorithmics, logic, higher-order languages, enhancements of the bisimulation 
proof method, and probabilities. Exercises are also included to help the reader 
master new material.
